page.topic: Creating a List of Switch Controls
page.description: A common design pattern in mobile applications is to have a series of Switch controls to set logical values.

discussion.p: A common design pattern in mobile applications is to have a series of Switch controls to set logical values. For example:

section.description: The list of Switch controls was created by wrapping it in a [ControlGroup Container] and modifying the style of the control and control's label. The *[ui:Width]* for every Switch control is also set to *[ui:100%]*, so it will fill the row.

description.p: Notice that the *[ui:Control Container Classname]* property has been set to a custom class name (code below.)

In the CSS, we first set the control container to have a relative position - which means all absolutely positioned child elements will be positioned relative to the parent - allowing parent width and position to be honored be the child.

We then set the first level of child DIVs (of which there is only one - the switch itself - the label is a *[html:<label>]* element) to have an absolute position, a specific width, and a right location of *[css:0px]* - which means it will stick to the right of the parent.
